Green Tide.flavor: Orks are pretty damn hard to kill. Orks seemingly killed in one battle often return in the next, either fixed up by a Mad Dok or simply miraculously healed—and tougher and stronger for the experience.
Green Tide.name: Green Tide

Grot Gunner.description: Increases the accuracy of Big Shootas and Twin-Linked Big Shootas.
Grot Gunner.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon match="Any">>
					<type name="BigShoota"/>
					<type name="TwinLinkedBigShoota"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Grot Gunner.name: Grot Gunner

Kustom Force Field.flavor: These bizarre devices are powered by crackling energy-coils and project invisible bubbles of energy that shield nearby Orks from incoming fire.
Kustom Force Field.name: Kustom Force Field

Bigga Choppas.flavor: When Orks think about upgrades, they don't think very hard. Mega-armour, Gigashootas… and bigga choppas. If you can carry it, you can swing it, and if you can swing it, you can hit someone with it.
Bigga Choppas.name: Bigga Choppas

Might Makes Right.flavor: The Orks only really feel alive when they're in a Waaagh! and a Waaagh! can only thrive through constant battle. As long as Orks are fighting, the Waaagh! should grow.
modifiers: - +300% Influence Per Combat From Upkeep Factor
- +33% Influence Per Combat From Upkeep Factor
Might Makes Right.name: Might Makes Right

Prophet of the Waaagh!.description: Grants influence based on the upkeep when attacking.
modifiers: - +50% Influence Per Combat From Upkeep Factor
Prophet of the Waaagh!.name: Prophet of the Waaagh!

Scavenger.description: Grants ore when killing an enemy.
Scavenger.flavor: Orks aren't known for their love of labour, preferring to sit around between battles picking bits of Squig out of their mouths and fighting each other. So rather than mine minerals from the ground, they tend to salvage them from, well, anywhere. Or rather their Grot underlings do.
Scavenger.name: Scavenger

Warbike Turbo-Boost.description: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.
Warbike Turbo-Boost.flavor:
“‘Fasta, fasta! Dey can’t ‘it wot dey can’t sees! Smack all dem turbos!”
  — Last words of Da Rok, Ork Nob and erstwhile warbiker
Warbike Turbo-Boost.name: Warbike Turbo-Boost

Warpath.description: Increases the number of melee attacks of the Weirdboy and adjacent Mob Rule allied units.
Warpath.flavor: The Weirdboy disperses the Waaagh! energy coursing through his frame into the Ork warriors around him, stirring their already bellicose, warlike nature to roaring fever pitch.
Warpath.name: Warpath

Outpost.description: Increases the damage reduction and the healing rate of allied units. Increases the ranged damage reduction of infantry units.
Outpost.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Features/Outpost">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<noTrait name="City"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<cityDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
				<healingRate mul="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="City"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>		
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Outpost.name: Outpost

Outflank.description: Increases the accuracy when adjacent to an allied unit.
Outflank.flavor: The best way to surprise an enemy is to strike from an unexpected quarter.
Outflank.name: Outflank

Pinned.description: Reduces the movement and ranged accuracy, increases the ranged damage reduction and prevents the unit from doing overwatch attacks.
Pinned.flavor: Coming under fire without knowing where the shots are coming from, or having ordnance rain down from the skies, can shake the resolve of even the bravest warriors, making them dive flat and cling to whatever cover presents itself.
Pinned.rawXML:
<trait category="Debuff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Bike"/>
					<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
					<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<movementMax mul="-0.67"/>
				<rangedAccuracy mul="-0.17"/>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Bike"/>
					<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
					<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<preventOverwatch add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Pinned.name: Pinned

Pinning.description: Temporarily reduces the movement of the target fearful infantry unit and prevents it from doing overwatch attacks.
Pinning.flavor: Coming under fire without knowing where the shots are coming from, or having ordnance rain down from the skies, can shake the resolve of even the bravest warriors, making them dive flat and cling to whatever cover presents itself.
Pinning.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<noTrait name="Bike"/>
						<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
						<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
						<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Pinned" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>
Pinning.name: Pinning

Poisoned.description: Increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Poisoned.flavor: There are many virulent and lethal poisons in the dark future. It is simplicity itself to adapt such toxins for battlefield use. It does not matter whether they coat weapon-blades or bullets, or are secreted by alien monstrosities – all are lethal.
Poisoned.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" rankMax="4" visibilityCategory="Weapon">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage addMin="0.25" addMax="4.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Poisoned.name: Poisoned

Power of the Machine Spirit.flavor: The interface between this vehicle's advanced machine spirit and its fire control mechanisms allows the crew to target foes with incredible accuracy.
Power of the Machine Spirit.name: Power of the Machine Spirit

Preferred Enemy.flavor: Many of the galaxy's warriors train hard to overcome a particular foe, allowing them to predict the enemy's battlestances and thus land a blow or shot with greater ease.
Preferred Enemy.name: Preferred Enemy

Psychic Block.description: Blocks the damage and effects of the next enemy psychic power.
Psychic Block.name: Psychic Block

Psychneuein Infest.description: Causes the target unit to spawn a Psychneuein when killed.
Psychneuein Infest.name: Psychneuein Infest

Psyker.flavor: Psykers are battlefield mystics who harness the power of the Warp.
Psyker.name: Psyker

Rage.flavor: Bloodlust is a powerful weapon on the battlefield, spurring a warrior to hack his foes apart in a flurry of mindless (but eminently satisfying) carnage.
Rage.name: Rage

Rampage.description: Increases the attacks when there are more enemies than allies in adjacent tiles.
Rampage.flavor: For some warriors, being outnumbered is not a cause for despair, but a call to set about their foes with a berserk counter-attack.
Rampage.name: Rampage

Rapid Fire.description: Doubles the attacks at half range.
Rapid Fire.name: Rapid Fire

Recovery Gear.flavor: Many crews load their vehicles with collections of tools, tow cables and other useful kit that can make the difference between digging an immobilized vehicle out of a tight spot or having to abandon it to its fate.
Recovery Gear.name: Recovery Gear

Red Paint Job.flavor: Orks believe that a vehicle painted red can outstrip a similar vehicle that isn't. As odd as it may seem, they're not wrong.
Red Paint Job.name: Red Paint Job

Refractor Field.flavor: Often carried by high-ranking officers and Imperial heroes, shimmering refractor fields refract incoming energy around their bearer, batting aside blasts and swinging blades that would otherwise lay them low.
Refractor Field.name: Refractor Field

Regeneration.flavor: Some units have the ability to recover from horrendous wounds and injuries that should have proven fatal.
Regeneration.name: Regeneration

Relentless.description: Negates the penalty for heavy, ordnance and salvo weapons.
Relentless.flavor: Relentless warriors are strong of arm—nothing can slow their implacable advance.
Relentless.name: Relentless

Relic Plating.flavor: Occasionally a crew will achieve an empathic relationship with the machine spirit of their battle tank. When such a crew perishes, their remains may be interred within their vehicle, spirits lingering protectively to drive away the baleful energies of the void.
Relic Plating.name: Relic Plating

Rending.description: Increases the damage and armour penetration.
Rending.flavor: Some weapons can inflict critical strikes against which no armour can protect.
Rending.name: Rending

Repulsor Grid.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction and returns ranged damage from weapons that are not blast, template or witchfire back to the attacker.
Repulsor Grid.name: Repulsor Grid

Rites of War.flavor: Honour-bound by sacred oaths of fealty to the Imperium, the Chaplain and his warriors vow before the Chapter and the Emperor to secure victory at any cost.
Rites of War.name: Rites of War

Rosarius.flavor: A rosarius is worn by Space Marine Chaplains for protection and as a symbol of office. It emits a protective energy field around the wearer capable of deflecting blows and shots that would smash a ferrocrete bunker. It is said that the stronger the bearer's belief in the might of the Emperor, the stronger a rosarius' force field will be.
Rosarius.name: Rosarius

Ruins Stealth.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction while in imperial ruins.
Ruins Stealth.name: Ruins Stealth

Salvo.description: Halves the attacks and range if the unit has moved.
Salvo.name: Salvo

Savant Interlocution.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against flyers and skimmers when adjacent to an allied Hunter.
Savant Interlocution.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
						<trait name="Skimmer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
				<unit>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<type name="SpaceMarines/Hunter"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy add="4"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Savant Interlocution.name: Savant Interlocution

Savant Lock.description: Increases the accuracy against flyers, jetbikes and skimmers.
Savant Lock.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
						<trait name="JetPack"/>
						<trait name="Jetbike"/>
						<trait name="Skimmer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Savant Lock.name: Savant Lock

Seeker Missile.description: Reduced range against targets not acquired by markerlight. Does not require line of sight against targets acquired by markerlight.
Seeker Missile.flavor: Seeker missiles are one-shot weapons usually guided to their targets by markerlights, though they can be fired independently as well.
Seeker Missile.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" icon="Weapons/SeekerMissile">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<ignoreLineOfSight add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangeMax add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Seeker Missile.name: Seeker Missile

Seeking.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against flyers.
Seeking.name: Seeking

Shaken.description: Reduces the accuracy and increases the damage taken.
Shaken.name: Shaken

Shielded.flavor: Some warriors are protected by more than mere physical armour. They may be shielded by force fields, enveloped in mystical energies or have a constitution that can shrug off hits that would put holes in a battle tank.
Shielded.name: Shielded

Shop.description: Allows hero units to purchase and sell items.
Shop.name: Shop

Shred.flavor: Some weapons and warriors strike in a flurry of blows, tearing flesh asunder in a series of brutal strikes.
Shred.name: Shred

Shrouded.flavor: The source of the darkness around these warriors matters not—only a lucky shot has any chance of piercing the shroud that hides them from view.
Shrouded.name: Shrouded

Siege Masters.description: Increases the damage against enemy units in cities and fortifications.
Siege Masters.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/SiegeMasters">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="City"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="City"/>
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Siege Masters.name: Siege Masters

Siege Shield.description: Increases the armour and reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Siege Shield.flavor: Many Vindicators are equipped with an enormous bulldozer blade, allowing them to shoulder aside battlefield detritus without risk.
Siege Shield.name: Siege Shield

Signum.flavor: The signum is a communication device that quickly processes and broadcasts targeting data. This ancient piece of technology allows one member of a Space Marine squad to fire with even greater accuracy, battering vital targets with a hail of unerring shots.
Signum.name: Signum

Anchorite Sarcophagus.flavor: To those Repentia who not only fled, but betrayed their Sisters in battle, an even worse fate awaits. After being wired into the crucible of their Mortifier they are further entombed behind thick adamantine casing. This sarcophagus protects their tortured bodies from incoming fire and desperately swung blades, denying them the release of death.
Anchorite Sarcophagus.name: Anchorite Sarcophagus

Angelic Visage.flavor: Beatifically smiling, Zephyrim deflect the strikes of their foes with fluid grace before landing a killing blow of their own, typically with a point-blank headshot from a bolt pistol or a strike of their power sword.
Angelic Visage.name: Angelic Visage

Anguish Of The Unredeemed.flavor: Mortifiers blaze a trail of destruction with their flamers before charging headlong into the foe, guilt and pain driving them on, heedless of danger. Even as they die, they strike at their enemy, striving for redemption with every moment.
Anguish Of The Unredeemed.name: Anguish Of The Unredeemed

Armour Of Saint Katherine.flavor: Ever since this revered suit of armour was anointed with a vial of blood from the martyred Saint Katherine it has been believed to have sacred powers of protection.
Armour Of Saint Katherine.name: Armour Of Saint Katherine

Furious Fusillade.flavor:
“The right attack, carefully placed, can defeat the most overwhelming of enemies. However, if we do not know the right attack? Then an overwhelming, inchoate assault will hit the right spot, eventually…”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Furious Fusillade.name: Furious Fusillade

Avenging Zeal.flavor:
“The loss of our Sisters and auxiliaries saddened us—but encouraged us to redouble our efforts.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Avenging Zeal.name: Avenging Zeal

Berserk Killing Machine.flavor: Tormented by neuro-agoniser arrays that amplify her self-loathing and divorced from her Sisters’ prayers by an enclosing baffle around her head, the unfortunate pilot’s spiritual suffering fuels the Mortifier. They storm forward as terrifying shock troops, before crashing into their foe.
Berserk Killing Machine.name: Berserk Killing Machine

Bloody Resolution.flavor: The Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas do not give in to despair when their leaders are slain. Instead, the blood of these martyred heroes only strengthens their resolve, the sacrifice inspiring them to great acts of heroism.
Bloody Resolution.name: Bloody Resolution

Catechism of Repugnance.description: Increases the ranged accuracy and ranged armor penetration of the target Adepta Sororitas allied unit.
Catechism of Repugnance.flavor: With the holy bolter we shall cleanse the mutant, the alien and the heretic. With the Emperor’s gift do we deliver our hatred of the defiler.
Catechism of Repugnance.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
				<rangedArmorPenetration addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Catechism of Repugnance.name: Catechism of Repugnance

Novitiates Recruitment.flavor: The Ork invasion and subsequent war on Gladius Prime left many, many orphans. Sending missionaries and preachers into the wastes to recruit for the armies of the Imperium will bolster our city’s growth.
Novitiates Recruitment.name: Novitiates Recruitment

Preceptory Annexes.flavor: Given the numbers of refugees pouring into the Preceptory from the ruined hives and wastelands of Gladius Prime, the Canoness Superior has ordered that we sanctify new land for use, bringing any natives into the fold—willingly or not.
Preceptory Annexes.name: Preceptory Annexes

Sanctuary Fortress.flavor: The Preceptory is more of a city now, resembling the hive cities that once dotted the planet’s surface. Beneath its bulk lies an undercity, above it tower spires and chantries. Perhaps only the Fortress-Monasteries of the Adeptus Astartes rival it in scale and holy adornment.
Sanctuary Fortress.name: Sanctuary Fortress

Divine Deliverance.description: This unit and adjacent allied Adepta Sororitas units cause attacked units to lose morale.
Divine Deliverance.flavor: Enemy warlords tremble before the divine majesty of one blessed by the Emperor, and their minions quake before the booming onslaught of such a warrior’s companions.
Divine Deliverance.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliverance">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<allied/>
						<attacking/>
						<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<morale addMin="-1" addMax="-3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>
Divine Deliverance.name: Divine Deliverance

Eternal Crusade.flavor:
“And we shall not rest, for the God-Emperor’s eye is on us. He sees every soul saved and knows that the number imperilled far outweighs it. We cannot stop, we cannot slow—ours is an eternal crusade.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute
Eternal Crusade.name: Eternal Crusade

Expert Fighters.flavor: In most strike wings a handful of aircrafts are flown by veteran pilotes. These fighter aces are truly dangerous foes, able to predict the reaction of their prey with uncanny precision. Few of them survive beyond one or two campaigns as they draw the most dangerous missions where only the most experienced prevail.
Expert Fighters.name: Expert Fighters

Flank Speed.description: Increases the movement, but prevents the use of ranged weapons.
Flank Speed.flavor:
“One should not question the nobility of Questor Imperialis. But for faith, none can match the Knight-Lancer, which goes into battle armed only with a spear and its own prodigious speed, praying that it makes it to the enemy lines. It is a fine match for our forces.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Flank Speed.name: Flank Speed

Enhanced Ordnance.flavor:
“Over the shells of the Castigator, we sprinkle the soil of holy Terra, raise our voices in prayer, and genuflect before the Shrine of St Katherine. Then we add 25% more explosive to each shell and cap them with adamantium.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Enhanced Ordnance.name: Enhanced Ordnance

Ion Gauntlet Shield.flavor: The ion gauntlet shield generator mounted in the Cerastus’ right gauntlet assembly is more concentrated than the directional ion shield mounted on the Knight Paladin, but lacks its tactical flexibility.
Ion Gauntlet Shield.name: Ion Gauntlet Shield

Keepers of the Faith.description: Prevents overwatch, but increases damage reduction.
Keepers of the Faith.flavor:
“Reason says, fire when you see the enemy. Reason says, use cover when the enemy fires at you. Reason says, die when you are shot. Reason does not understand our faith and how we keep it.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Keepers of the Faith.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<actionPoints greater="0"/>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<preventOverwatch add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<actionPoints greater="0"/>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<invulnerableDamageReduction min="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Keepers of the Faith.name: Keepers of the Faith

Knight Parry.flavor: The ion gauntlet shield generator mounted in the Cerastus’ right gauntlet assembly can be used to deflect the mightiest hits in close-combat.
Knight Parry.rawXML:
<trait category="Debuff">
	<modifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<trait name="Gargantuan"/>
					<trait name="SuperHeavy"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<meleeAccuracy add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Knight Parry.name: Knight Parry

Laud Hailer.description: This unit can still perform acts of faith if it is shaken.
Laud Hailer.flavor: Proclaiming the power of the Emperor in heavenly tones, a Laud Hailer bolsters the spirits of the faithful.
Laud Hailer.name: Laud Hailer

Lead The Righteous.flavor:
“A Canoness is no skulking commissar, to hide behind her sisters’ skirts and send them to her deaths. My role is to lead from the front, to inspire love and faith by my example. For we are the righteous of the Emperor and we will not fail in our aim.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute
Lead The Righteous.name: Lead The Righteous

Light of the Emperor.description:
Increases the accuracy.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Light of the Emperor.flavor: Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas are filled with the knowledge that the only thing they need fear is failing the Emperor of Mankind. Armed with such faith, they are driven to unprecedented feats of prowess.
Light of the Emperor.name: Light of the Emperor

Martyrdom.description: On death, reduces the morale loss of all allied Adepta Sororitas units.
Martyrdom.flavor: The Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas do not give in to despair when their leaders are slain. Instead, the blood of these martyred heroes only strengthens their resolve, the sacrifice inspiring them to great acts of heroism.
Martyrdom.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff">
	<onUnitDisappeared>
		<area affects="Unit" radius="999">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/BloodyResolution" duration="2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
	</onUnitDisappeared>
</trait>
Martyrdom.name: Martyrdom

Martyr Spirit.description: On death, reduces the morale loss of adjacent allied units with Shield of Faith.
Martyr Spirit.flavor:
“The loss of our Sisters and auxiliaries saddened us—but encouraged us to redouble our efforts.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Martyr Spirit.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff">
	<onUnitDisappeared>
		<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/AvengingZeal" duration="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
	</onUnitDisappeared>
</trait>
Martyr Spirit.name: Martyr Spirit

Medicus Ministorum.flavor: A Medicus Ministorum is a medical field kit used by members of the Adeptus Ministorum and by the Hospitallers of the Adepta Sororitas. Contained within a rare scentwood box are a collection of relics which are used to cure all manner of injuries and ailments.
Medicus Ministorum.name: Medicus Ministorum

Blessed Blades.flavor: The weapons of the Adepta Sororitas differ little from those requisitioned by the Astra Militarum, save in two regards: the quality of their maintenance; and the sacred benisons and supplications made over them. This latter only can explain the miracles that occur in combat, where these blessed blades find the smallest weakness time and time again.
Blessed Blades.name: Blessed Blades

Miraculous Intervention.description:
After dying, Saint Celestine immediately comes back to life.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Miraculous Intervention.flavor: Not even death can stop the Emperor’s chosen servants, and through his benevolence they rise again to serve the Master of Mankind’s will.
Miraculous Intervention.name: Miraculous Intervention

Ministorum Mobilisation.flavor: The rites of the Ecclesiarchy are not merely militaristic: prayers and liturgies exist for all functions of the Imperium. To be the focus of such a rite, whether Famulus or Pronatus or even the most base worker, drives them on to greater efforts.
Ministorum Mobilisation.name: Ministorum Mobilisation

Oath Of Faith.description: Reduces the accuracy and prevents the use of Shield of Faith.
Oath Of Faith.flavor:
“We all took an oath, to defend the Imperium, to purge the heretic and alien. It supported us, drove us on through pain and fear. But when our sisters finally broke and fled, our oath haunted them… If they survived their flight, they would return as Sisters Repentia…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Oath Of Faith.name: Oath Of Faith

Paragon Warsuit.flavor: Among the holy arsenal of an Order Militant, the ancient Paragon Warsuits are regarded as sacred vestments with a noble will of their own. Only the most worth Celestians can master its spirit for use in battle.
Paragon Warsuit.name: Paragon Warsuit

Protected.flavor: Celestians are those Sisters most filled with martial spirit, proving themselves in the most intense melees. They frequently serve as bodyguards and champions of Canonesses, willingly sacrificing themselves to protect their charge.
Protected.name: Protected

PsyShock.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="Psyker"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="Psyker"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Stunned" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>	
</trait>
PsyShock.name: PsyShock

Purifying Recitations.flavor:
“Our foes call us cold, inhuman, unfeeling. But we feel, we mourn, we rage. Let them feel our warmth—in our flamers, our meltas.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Purifying Recitations.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Weapon" icon="Actions/SistersOfBattle/PurifyingRecitations">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon match="Any">
					<trait name="Melta"/>
					<trait name="Flame"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Purifying Recitations.name: Purifying Recitations

Raging Fervour.flavor:
“The weapons in our hands are the instruments of our faith. Each bolt is a prayer sent to the heart of the faithless, spreading its word into their very being.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Raging Fervour.name: Raging Fervour

Righteous Judgement.description: Ignores ranged damage reduction and increases damage taken by the target enemy unit.
Righteous Judgement.flavor: None can escape the Emperor’s judgement, and wherever the foe attempts to seek shelter the shots of the Adepta Sororitas miraculously seek them out.
Righteous Judgement.name: Righteous Judgement

Sacresant Shield.flavor: The faithful Celestian Sacresants stand firm against the worst horrors of the galaxy. Hordes of mutants and heretics crash futilely against their shield walls before being laid low with righteous fury.
Sacresant Shield.name: Sacresant Shield

Saintly Blessings.flavor: In the presence of an ordained Living Saint, even the most impious of the Emperor’s servants cannot help but be swept up by the tide of religious fervour.
Saintly Blessings.name: Saintly Blessings

Shield of Faith.flavor: Members of the Adepta Sororitas are taught that faith is a shield stronger than any armour. Such is the power of their belief that the Emperor will protect them that the Adepta Sororitas can shrug off the most severe of wounds and resist the witchcraft of enemy sorcerers.
Shield of Faith.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<invulnerableDamageReduction min="0.17"/>
				<witchfireDamageReduction min="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0" requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/VowOfTheMilitantOrder">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<trait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<invulnerableDamageReduction min="0.17"/>
				<witchfireDamageReduction min="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Shield of Faith.name: Shield of Faith

Sister Superior.description: Increases the morale of infantry and Paragon Warsuits units.
Sister Superior.flavor: It is the Sisters Superior who form the true lynchpins of each squad of Battle Sisters. Speaking with authority derived from years of combat experience and supreme faith in the God-Emperor, these remarkable officers ensure that every Sister under their command fights to the full extent of her abilities and endurance, thereby maximising the strategic impact of the squad as a whole.
Sister Superior.name: Sister Superior

Solace in Anguish.description:
Increases the damage reduction.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Solace in Anguish.flavor:
“I had seen a Preacher impaled on a steeple. The remains of a missionary found by genestealer cultists. We felt the loss so strongly—but our anguish did not weaken us, but spurred us on…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Solace in Anguish.name: Solace in Anguish

Stirring Rhetoric.flavor:
“There is no light but the light of the Emperor! There is no faith but faith in the Emperor! There is no truth but the truth of the Emperor!”
  — First Exclamation of the Dialogus Order of the Resounding Vow
Stirring Rhetoric.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoric" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit match="Any">
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention"/>
				</unit>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<armor addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Stirring Rhetoric.name: Stirring Rhetoric

Tale of the Faithful.description: Increases the movement of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Faithful.flavor: From a young age, the initiates of the Adepta Sororitas exercise and pray backed by the sonorous songs of the Imagifiers, inspired to superhuman feats by the testaments of their long-dead sisters. Even cynical veterans, hearing the song in their dotage, are inspired to transcend their body’s limitations, moving with impossible swiftness and blessed grace.
Tale of the Faithful.name: Tale of the Faithful

Tale of the Stoic.description: Increases the damage reduction of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Stoic.flavor: Hearing the stories of the Emperor’s eternal suffering and silent resilience, each Sister is filled with His courage. Their will-to-fight in His name is indefatigable and they push through injuries so grievous that an average man would be long-dead from shock. Yet they are neither average nor men.
Tale of the Stoic.name: Tale of the Stoic

Tale of the Warrior.description: Increases the melee damage of adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Warrior.flavor: When the Imagifiers chant their tales of ancient battles of Istvaan V, of Sanguinius at the Eternity Gate, of Horus’ downfall, the Battle Sisters become suffused with the martial spirit of their forebears, every blow landing like the Emperor’s fist.
Tale of the Warrior.name: Tale of the Warrior

The Passion.flavor: A Canoness leads her Sisters through the chaos of melee, striking at their foes with a speed and hatred born of holy fervour.
The Passion.name: The Passion

Used Act Of Faith.description: This unit used its act of faith ability this turn.
Used Act Of Faith.flavor: This unit used its act of faith ability this turn.
Used Act Of Faith.name: Used Act Of Faith

Vengeful Spirit.description: Returns damage back to the attacker.
Vengeful Spirit.flavor:
“And in death, we have one last chance—a release from worry. Once dying, there is nothing holding back our fury, no need for self-preservation. We can use up all that we are, take all the blow that come our way, for one last chance at justice.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Vengeful Spirit.name: Vengeful Spirit

War Hymn.flavor: Suffer not the enemies of Mankind to live. Smite them down with all your strength and fury.
War Hymn.name: War Hymn

Mechanised Wrath.flavor:
“In those last days, the fervour spread. The Rite of Suppliance was performed, to demand the utmost from the Machine Spirits that ran the Manufactora and the Hangars where the ancient war engines were anointed. They did not disappoint.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Mechanised Wrath.name: Mechanised Wrath

Skilled Jink.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction but reduces the accuracy.
Skilled Jink.flavor: Some units favour speed and agility rather than heavy armour to keep them alive on the battlefield, dodging and weaving unscathed through hails of incoming fire.
Skilled Jink.name: Skilled Jink

Skimmer.description: The unit can move over water. Ignores the penalties of rivers and wire weed. Reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Skimmer.flavor: Some highly advanced vehicles are fitted with anti-gravity drives that allow them to skim swiftly over tough terrain and intervening troops, making them perfect for surprise flanking attacks.
Skimmer.name: Skimmer

Skull Altar.description: Provides a reward to units entering the tile.
Skull Altar.flavor: Rising from the ground, the Skull Altar is formed out of the violent tributes heaped in offering for Khorne's Throne. From atop the grisly pedestal a priest of Khorne roars out invectives, evoking the judgements of the Blood God to smite down all signs of weakness.
Skull Altar.name: Skull Altar

Skulls for the Skull Throne.flavor: Khorne respects only the strong and boundlessly murderous.
Skulls for the Skull Throne.name: Skulls for the Skull Throne

Skyfire.description: Increases the accuracy against flyers. Reduces the accuracy against ground units that are not skimmer, jetbike or jet pack.
Skyfire.flavor: Skyfire weapons excel at shooting down enemy aircraft and skimmers.
Skyfire.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
						<noTrait name="JetPack"/>
						<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
						<noTrait name="Skimmer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy mul="-0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Skyfire.name: Skyfire

Slow and Purposeful.description: Negates the penalty for heavy and ordnance weapons.
Slow and Purposeful.flavor: Many warriors are steady but sure, slow to advance but no less deadly for it.
Slow and Purposeful.name: Slow and Purposeful

Smash.flavor: For the most fearsome of creatures, a single blow is sufficient to breach a tank's armour or crush a living creature to bloody pulp.
Smash.name: Smash

Smoke Screen.flavor: Some vehicles have small launchers mounted onto them that carry smoke canisters. These are used to temporarily obscure the vehicle behind billowing clouds of smoke, allowing it to cross open areas in greater safety—although it does so at the cost of being able to fire its own weapons.
Smoke Screen.name: Smoke Screen

Sniper.description: Increases the damage and armour penetration against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Sniper.flavor: Sniper weapons are precision instruments, used to pick out a target’s weak points.
Sniper.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="1.0"/>
				<armorPenetration min="4"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Sniper.name: Sniper

Bolter Discipline.description: If the unit remains stationary, they fire Rapid Fire weapons with increased attacks at all ranges.
Bolter Discipline.flavor: To a Space Marine, the boltgun is more than a weapon—it is an instrument of Mankind’s divinity, the bringer of death to his foes.
Bolter Discipline.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Traits/RapidFire">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<notMovedThisTurn/>
				</unit>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="RapidFire"/>
				</weapon>
				<encounterRange greater="1"/>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAttacks mul="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Bolter Discipline.name: Bolter Discipline

Fortress Expansion.flavor: The second stage of the Fortress' construction has started. With the core facilities established, the Techmarines are authorised to expand their operations and create a second defensive line.
Fortress Expansion.name: Fortress Expansion

Advanced Redoubts.flavor: The third stage of the Fortress construction involves the creation of independent garrisons and buttresses along an additional line of city walls. In the shadow of those cyclopean barriers, Servitors and serfs spend their lives, scurrying from one task to another.
Advanced Redoubts.name: Advanced Redoubts

Fortress Supreme.flavor: With this expansion, the Master Artificer declares the fortress complete. Now it rivals in scale a Hive City. Inside its impregnable walls, you could be anywhere in the Imperium. Outside, the local tribes come from enormous distances to pay tribute, whilst their finest warriors hope to be accepted for the lethal trials that might lead to their being modified into a Space Marine.
Fortress Supreme.name: Fortress Supreme

Close-quarters Firepower.flavor: At shorter ranges, the range of weapons designed by Belisarius Cawl for his Primaris marines are lethally effective, encouraging the Emperor’s finest to close the distance with their foes.
Close-quarters Firepower.name: Close-quarters Firepower

Duty Eternal.flavor: All Adeptus Astartes possess an indomitable will. Yet those few Primaris given the privilege of being encased in a Redemptor Dreadnought after their effective death know a deeper responsibility, of living up to this unique honour. They will fight on no matter how grievous the injury or how severe the damage.
Duty Eternal.name: Duty Eternal

Stronghold Shielding.flavor: Gladius Prime is already proving far more hostile than the Adeptus Administratum's worst forecasts. With the Fortress' physical defenses under almost constant assault, the Techmarines approve installation of a void shield. Once constructed, this shimmering dome of power is sufficient to warp away the firepower of entire battalions (or even a rogue Imperial Knight) before collapsing.
Stronghold Shielding.name: Stronghold Shielding

Close Combat Mastery.flavor: Certain Adeptus Astartes chapters—the Space Wolves, the Blood Drinkers, the Minotaurs—are renowned for their mastery of close-quarters combat. To come to blows with even the lowliest Scout Marine from such a chapter is to fight generations of knowledge and training.
Close Combat Mastery.name: Close Combat Mastery

Omniscope.flavor: Centurions make use of omniscopes to better direct their fearsome firepower and pierce the gloom of a hostile galaxy.
Omniscope.name: Omniscope

Repulsor Field.flavor: When Arkhan Land rediscovered the STC for anti-gravity devices, it is unlikely that he intended them as yet another weapon in the Repulsor tank’s already weighty arsenal. Yet, as a Repulsor Executioner coasts to a halt, it discharges directed crushing pulses of gravitic force through its ventral grab plates, pinning any foes just before its cargo of Primaris marines spring upon them…
Repulsor Field.name: Repulsor Field

Suppressive Bombardment.description: Increases the damage and attacks pin down enemy infantry when adjacent to another Whirlwind.
Suppressive Bombardment.flavor: The Codex Astartes dictates that Whirlwinds operate best in larger groups, laying down a rolling barrage that cannot be avoided but must instead be endured. Even when sheltered, lighter-armoured troops and vehicles are utterly devastated by the relentless rain of warheads.
Suppressive Bombardment.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<type name="SpaceMarines/Whirlwind"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<noTrait name="Bike"/>
						<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
						<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
						<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
				<unit>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<type name="SpaceMarines/Whirlwind"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Pinned" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>
Suppressive Bombardment.name: Suppressive Bombardment

Storm Shield.flavor: A storm shield is a large, solid shield that has an energy field generator built into it. Though the bulk of the shield offers physical protection, it is the energy field which is more impressive, as it is capable of deflecting almost any attack. Even blows that would normally cut through Terminator armour are turned aside with ease by the protective energies of the storm shield.
Storm Shield.name: Storm Shield

Thunderstrike.description: Increases the ranged damage from Space Marines units against this unit.
Thunderstrike.flavor: The heavily armed Storm Speeders designed by Belisarius Cawl are specialised against certain targets, with the Thunderstrike focused on eliminating enemy vehicles and key targets. Indeed, a foe crippled by its armaments becomes even more vulnerable to follow-up attacks by fellow battle brothers.
Thunderstrike.name: Thunderstrike

Stealth.flavor: Some warriors are masters of disguise and concealment, able to fade into the ruin of a battlefield until they are ready to strike.
Stealth.name: Stealth

Strafing Run.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against ground units.
Strafing Run.flavor: This vehicle is designed as a ground attack craft, the spread and convergence distance of its weapons keyed to maximise carnage on the foes below.
Strafing Run.name: Strafing Run

Strikedown.description: Temporarily reduces the movement of target infantry unit.
Strikedown.flavor: A sufficiently powerful blow can knock even the mightiest warrior off his feet.
Strikedown.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Slowed" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>
Strikedown.name: Strikedown

Stubborn.flavor: Many warriors live and die according to the principle of 'death before dishonour'. Seldom do such warriors take a backward step in the face of danger.
Stubborn.name: Stubborn

Stunned.description: Prevents the unit from moving or acting.
Stunned.name: Stunned

Suicider.description: Enemies do not gain experience when this unit kills itself.
Suicider.name: Suicider

Summon.rawXML:
<trait>
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<biomassUpkeep max="0"/>
				<foodUpkeep max="0"/>
				<oreUpkeep max="0"/>
				<requisitionsUpkeep max="0"/>
				<energyUpkeep max="0"/>
				<influenceUpkeep max="0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onTraitRemovedModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<removeUnit/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onTraitRemovedModifiers>
</trait>
Summon.name: Summon

Super-Heavy.flavor: Huge armour-clad constructions that each carry enough firepower to vaporise, smash or incinerate an entire army.
Super-Heavy.name: Super-Heavy

Supersonic.flavor: Supersonic vehicles are supremely fast, even by the normal standards of aircraft, making them exceptionally mobile in battle.
Supersonic.name: Supersonic

Swarms.description: Damage taken is spread evenly across the whole unit group, but the group takes additional hits against blast and template weapons.
Swarms.flavor: These creatures are so multitudinous that they cannot be picked out individually and must be fought as a group.
Swarms.name: Swarms

Tactical Doctrine.flavor:
“They shall be pure of heart and strong of body, untainted by doubt and unsullied by self-aggrandisement. They will be bright stars on the firmament of battle, Angels of Death whose shining wings bring swift annihilation to the enemies of Man. So it shall be for a thousand times for a thousand years, unto the very end of eternity and the extinction of mortal flesh.”
  — Codex Astartes, by Roboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent
Tactical Doctrine.name: Tactical Doctrine

Tank.flavor: Tanks can use their mass as a weapon, driving right into and through densely packed enemies. This often throws the opposing battle line into disarray, as having some monstrous metal behemoth coming straight at you is unnerving for anybody.
Tank.name: Tank

Tank Hunters.description: Increases the armour penetration against enemy vehicles.
Tank Hunters.flavor: These veterans of armoured warfare are able to identify the weak points of enemy vehicles and target their fire appropriately.
Tank Hunters.name: Tank Hunters

Advanced Targeting System.flavor: An advanced targeting system assists the vehicle's gunner by identifying targets of particular value or danger and plotting fire plans to counter them.
Advanced Targeting System.name: Advanced Targeting System

Automated Repair System.flavor: Tiny maintenance drones swarm over damaged systems to repair them in the midst of battle.
Automated Repair System.name: Automated Repair System

Blacksun Filter.flavor: This optical filtering suite allows vehicle sensors to target enemies at full efficiency and range, even during night fighting operations.
Blacksun Filter.name: Blacksun Filter

Blast Phasing.flavor: Area-effect weaponry has always been better placed to attack large infantry formations than hard targets like vehicles—but the Earth Caste engineers have figured a way past that. By phase-shifting the energy components of explosive and incendiary weapons, they can ensure that at least some of their effect will ‘leak’ past any shielding.
Blast Phasing.name: Blast Phasing

Brachyuran Assemblies.flavor: Even the finest Earth Caste technician can’t assemble the components of their rail weapons by hand. But by entrusting this work to the tiny Brachyuran race and supplying them with miniaturised tools, they can shrink the scale and lower the fundamental deviation of any delicate operations, allowing for even more finerly tuned weaponry.
Brachyuran Assemblies.name: Brachyuran Assemblies

Break Composure.flavor: Though not physically impressive, the T’au can inculcate fear in their enemies through subtler means—by harrying them so that they can’t focus, by surrounding them, by forcing them down tactical paths that only lead to repeated failure. Sometimes you don’t need to even touch an enemy to defeat them.
Break Composure.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/Tau/BreakComposure">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<morale addMin="-2" addMax="-6"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>
Break Composure.name: Break Composure

Dissemination.flavor: Once a city is a certain size, the Water Caste begin a diplomatic offensive to bring more civilians to the Way—bombarding them with tailored propaganda of every form, from pamphlast drops to vid, rad and loudhailer broadcasts.
Dissemination.name: Dissemination

Anthrazod Foundations.flavor: The thick-skinned Anthrazods are a slow-thinking race normally employed by the T'au for dangerous, heavy-duty activities like asteroid mining—but directed by the Demiurg and Earth Caste, they can produce city substructures and transport tunnels like no-one else, linking up distant sectors with ease.
Anthrazod Foundations.name: Anthrazod Foundations

Cluster Fire.description: Increases attacks and damage against units that are bikes, jetbikes or very bulky. Greatly increases attacks and damage against units that are monstrous creatures, vehicles or fortifications.
Cluster Fire.flavor: The R’Varna’s unique Pulse Submunition Cannons work at extreme ranges, saturating their target area with micro-bursts of plasma. The larger the target, the more burst-waves of plasma strike near-simultaneously, ripping it into smaller pieces with ease.
Cluster Fire.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="VeryBulky"/>
						<trait name="Jetbike"/>
						<trait name="Bike"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.17"/>
				<attacks mul="1.0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
				<attacks mul="2.0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Cluster Fire.name: Cluster Fire

Counterfire Defence System.description: Increases the accuracy of overwatch attacks.
Counterfire Defence System.flavor: These AI sensor suites incorporate predictive logic circuits to ensure that assaulting enemies are met with a withering hail of fire.
Counterfire Defence System.name: Counterfire Defence System

Disruption Pod.flavor: A disruption pod throws out distorting images in both visual and magnetic spectra, making it hard to target the vehicle at range.
Disruption Pod.name: Disruption Pod

Drone Controller.description: Increases the accuracy of adjacent drones.
Drone Controller.flavor: A Drone controller acts as an interface between a Fire caste operator and the AI battle programs of nearby drones.
Drone Controller.name: Drone Controller

Drone Controller In Range.flavor: A Drone controller acts as an interface between a Fire caste operator and the AI battle programs of nearby drones.
Drone Controller In Range.name: Drone Controller In Range

Field Amplifier Relay.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction when the unit is shielded.
Field Amplifier Relay.flavor: Taking the form of a lightweight backpack unit, the field amplifier relay picks up the protective force field of the Shield Drone, spreading it in an energised umbrella over its bearer and beaming the signal on to other relays within range.
Field Amplifier Relay.name: Field Amplifier Relay

Fire Team.description: Increases the ranged accuracy when adjacent to an allied vehicle or monstrous creature.
Fire Team.flavor: Some battlesuits and battle tank sensor-systems can be networked to provide enhanced efficiency when they fight in dedicated fire teams.
Fire Team.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit match="Any">
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<trait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					</unitsInRange>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Fire Team.name: Fire Team

Flechette Discharger.flavor: Powerful clusters of reactive charges are attached to the hulls of many T'au vehicles. If the enemy approaches, the clusters fire off vicious clouds of high velocity flechettes.
Flechette Discharger.name: Flechette Discharger

Ghostkeel Electrowarfare Suite.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction against attacks from range 2 or higher.
Ghostkeel Electrowarfare Suite.flavor: The Ghostkeel's AI electrowarfare suite aggressively scans enemy targeting spectrums and invades the foe's sensor arrays, filling them with false information and scrap-data that makes it almost impossible to effectively fire upon the battlesuit at range.
Ghostkeel Electrowarfare Suite.name: Ghostkeel Electrowarfare Suite

Holophoton Countermeasures.flavor: Triggered by AI-assisted threat-warning protocols, holophoton countermeasures take the form of a targeted barrage of holo-decoys, friendly target simulacra and stroboscopic blasts. Enemy weapons are confounded, safety-switches engaging and machine spirits rebelling while their operators are left bewildered and blinded by the overwhelming sensory overload.
Holophoton Countermeasures.name: Holophoton Countermeasures

Integrated Shield Generator.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction and grants an improved ranged invulnerable damage reduction.
Integrated Shield Generator.flavor: Unlike the Riptide, the R’Varna Battlesuit is intended for long-distance fire support and not mobility, allowing it to carry heavier armour. Similarly, its shield generator is still effective against close-ranged assaults, but operates optimally when the enemy is attacking from distance.
Integrated Shield Generator.name: Integrated Shield Generator

Kauyon (Patient Hunter).flavor:
“Your troops are losing. They fall back! They flee! The enemy pursues, hungry for our valourous blood! Everything is lost… then your troops turn and fire. You reveal the flanking troops. And your enemy is in a pocket, encircled. The patient hunter triumphs.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/Tau/Kauyon">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<rangedDamageReduction addMin="0.1" addMax="0.3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).name: Kauyon (Patient Hunter)

Mor'tonium Accelerators.flavor: As humanity has discovered to its cost, over and over, using radioactive materials in weaponry is always dangerous. It’s reasonable to assume the T’au are cognisant of this, but choose to use the recently discovered Mor’tonium in their military technology anyway. Upon exposure to air, it rapidly decays into a massive burst of ionic energy that the T’au use.
Mor'tonium Accelerators.name: Mor'tonium Accelerators

Mobile Defence Platform.description: Increases the movement while transporting cargo.
Mobile Defence Platform.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<cargoSlotsTaken greater="0"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<movementMax add="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onTransportEmbarked>
		<area affects="Unit">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<notMovedThisTurn/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<movement add="999"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
	</onTransportEmbarked>
	<onTransportDisembarked>
		<area affects="Unit">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<cargoSlotsTaken equal="0"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<movement add="-999"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
	</onTransportDisembarked>
</trait>
Mobile Defence Platform.name: Mobile Defence Platform

Mont'ka (Killing Blow).description: Increases the damage against units below 50% hitpoints.
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).flavor:
“Your enemy builds his force carefully. At its centre, lie his core units. You feign weakness. You draw them out. And you focus your fire on them. Without them, the enemy is lost. Cut off the head, the beast dies. Well, except for Be’gel.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/Tau/Montka">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<hitpointsFraction less="0.5"/>
						<noAttacking/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mulMin="0.25" mulMax="0.75"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).name: Mont'ka (Killing Blow)

Networked Markerlight.description: Increases the ranged accuracy and ranged damage reduction bypass. The unit's attacks do not benefit from or consume Target Acquired.
Networked Markerlight.flavor: These markerlights are networked directly into weapon systems, allowing them to deliver their payload with pinpoint accuracy.
Networked Markerlight.name: Networked Markerlight

Nova Boost.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
Nova Boost.name: Nova Boost

Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.description: Hits all group members of the target unit.
Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.flavor: The experimental Nova Reactors are only used on a handful of Battlesuit designs. Damage cannot be avoided from their use, but sometimes they must be employed for the Greater Good to supercharge offensive or defensive weapon systems—or, as here, to render the Battlesuit’s local area utterly lethal with a burst of raw power.
Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.name: Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave

Nova Fire.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
Nova Fire.name: Nova Fire

Nova Shield.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
Nova Shield.name: Nova Shield

Point Defence Targeting Relay.description: Increases overwatch damage against enemy units adjacent to other friendly units.
Point Defence Targeting Relay.flavor: Designed to provide superior covering fire for nearby Fire caste units, a point defense relay automatically targets and engages enemies that attempt to assault.
Point Defence Targeting Relay.name: Point Defence Targeting Relay

Pulse Accelerator.description: Increases the range of pulse weapons.
Pulse Accelerator.flavor: This device emits a powerful induction field that accelerates the charges of pulse weapons, increasing their range.
Pulse Accelerator.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/Tau/PulseAccelerator">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon match="Any">
					<type name="PulseBlaster"/>
					<type name="PulseDriverCannon"/>
					<type name="PulseRifle"/>
					<type name="PulseSubmunitionsCannon"/>
					<type name="TwinLinkedPulseCarbine"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangeMax add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Pulse Accelerator.name: Pulse Accelerator

Pulse Blaster.description: Increases the damage and armor penetration of overwatch attacks.
Pulse Blaster.flavor: Though the T’au rightly fear close-range warfare, the necessity of warfare on space hulks or labyrinthine Imperial hive worlds led to the development of the Pulse Blaster—colloquially called a Pulse Shotgun. Uniquely, the Blaster paints its target with negatively charged particules a moment before shooting, to increase the effect when the full plasma payload hits.
Pulse Blaster.name: Pulse Blaster

Rinyon (Circle of Blades).description: Increases the accuracy against units adjacent to other allied units.
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).flavor:
“Your enemy encircles you. His troops are close. Too close. Your targeting network assigns every Fire Caste a victim, not his neighbour. You fire as one, every shot strikes, they fall as one. A distracted enemy is as good as dead.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/Tau/Rinyon">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<supportingFire/>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy mulMin="0.1" mulMax="0.3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).name: Rinyon (Circle of Blades)

Riptide Shield Generator.flavor: Within a Riptide battlesuit's ablative shield is housed a small energy field generator whose potency can be further boosted by diverting power from the XV104's nova reactor.
Riptide Shield Generator.name: Riptide Shield Generator

Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).description: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).flavor:
“The enemy’s armour is thick, your blade makes only a scratch. In his arrogance, he allows you to strike. Hit the same spot, ten, a hundred, a thousand times. That scratch becomes a dent becomes a hole becomes his death. Water erodes the stone.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).name: Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers)

Ripyka'va.description: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.
Ripyka'va.flavor: Commander Coldflame was famed for her subtlety, her ability to layer tactics on tactics but somehow inspire her troops to strive to match her strategic complexity. Some whispered, however, that she concerned herself too deeply with the Greater Good for a mere Fire Warrior…
Ripyka'va.name: Ripyka'va

Sense of Stone.flavor:
“There are only four thoughts the Fire Caste must know. Knowing when to hide. Knowing when to defend. Knowing when to mislead. And knowing when to strike. Ask nothing more.”
  — Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit
Sense of Stone.name: Sense of Stone

Shield Generator.flavor: This generator projects a choesive energy field capable of protecting the bearer from heavy ordnance and anti-tank weapons fire.
Shield Generator.name: Shield Generator

Stabilising Anchors.description: Increases the ranged attacks if the unit has not moved this turn.
Stabilising Anchors.flavor: KV128 Stormsurge Ballistic Suits are too large to mount a jetpack like their Battle Suit counterparts. Instead, the Earth Caste scientist Bork'an designed them to lock into place once deployed, allowing them to divert all their reactor power to their immense weaponry.
Stabilising Anchors.name: Stabilising Anchors

Stimulant Injector.flavor: The battlesuit is fitted with an advanced life-support system that is able to flood the warrior's system with analgesic drugs and life-sustaining stimulants should he become wounded.
Stimulant Injector.name: Stimulant Injector

Storm of Fire.flavor:
“It burns so briefly, the light of my children, so briefly. But, by the Greater Good, it burns so bright!”
  — Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit
Storm of Fire.name: Storm of Fire

Subvert City.flavor:
“What’s that? You call that a house!? Someone lives in that?! Oh my. Well, it shows just how brave you all are. Your masters know you don’t need proper shelter or water or food or sleep or rest to die doing your jobs, for the ‘Great Emperator’! If he even exists. Anyway, if you change your mind about joining the T’au, do let me know.”
  — Por'el Dal'kor Slytongue, water caste emissary
Subvert City.rawXML:
<trait category="Debuff" icon="Actions/Tau/SubvertCity" visibilityCategory="Building">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<trait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<loyalty add="-3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier requiredUpgrade="Tau/SubversionBonus">
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<trait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<loyalty add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Subvert City.name: Subvert City

Support Systems.flavor: T’au Battle Suits are designed to be modular, so that the Earth Caste may customise them easily to suit different combat situations. Each suit only has a limited number of hardpoints though and reducing a suit’s firepower is always a hard choice.
Support Systems.name: Support Systems

Supporting Fire.description: Increases overwatch damage against enemy units adjacent to other allied units.
Supporting Fire.flavor: Fire caste doctrine, as laid down in the Code of Fire, instructs every warrior to protect their comrades. Using overlapping fields of fire, teams provide each other this mutual support on the battlefield.
Supporting Fire.name: Supporting Fire

Target Acquired.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of T'au against the unit. Reduces the ranged damage reduction of the unit against T'au. Ends after the unit is attacked by T'au.
Target Acquired.flavor: No other race is as committed to working together as the T’au, and the Markerlight is an excellent example of this. It’s a handheld targeting laser that is networked into the T’au’s information system, allowing for pinpoint strikes by other T’au forces.
Target Acquired.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Debuff" icon="Actions/Tau/Markerlight">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<faction name="Tau"/>
						<noTrait name="Tau/NetworkedMarkerlight"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<opponentRangedAccuracy add="1"/>
				<rangedDamageReduction max="0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onCombatSelfModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<attacking/>
						<faction name="Tau"/>
						<noTrait name="Tau/NetworkedMarkerlight"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<removeTrait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatSelfModifiers>
</trait>
Target Acquired.name: Target Acquired

Tidewall Shieldline.description: Returns ranged damage from weapons that are not blast, template or witchfire back to the attacker.
Tidewall Shieldline.flavor: The most commonly seen fortification utilised by the forces of the T'au Empire is the Tidewall Shieldline, a wall of energy behind which infantry can take cover. As the enemy's fusillades hiss and crack harmlessly from the Shieldline's refractive field, the Fire Warriors it protects unleash a blistering hail of pulse fire in return. Worse still for any aggressor attempting to drive the T'au from cover, this force-wall can redirect kinetic energy, sending las-blasts and armour-piercing shells ricocheting back into the enemy ranks.
Tidewall Shieldline.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Traits/Tau/TidewallShieldline">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
				<unit>
					<faction name="Tau"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
				</unit>
				<encounter>
					<weapon>
						<noTrait name="Melee"/>
						<noTrait name="Witchfire"/>
						<additionalMembersHit equal="0"/>
					</weapon>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damageReturnFactor add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		
		
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
				<unit>
					<faction name="Tau"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
		</modifier>
		
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Tidewall Shieldline.name: Tidewall Shieldline

Unity.description: Increases the loyalty output of all cities.
Unity.flavor: Though the Commanders are the icons of T’au propaganda, it is the Fireblades who are quietly regarded as the true heroes—warriors good enough to don Battle Suits who choose instead to stay with the rank and file, training them for the Greater Good. They are the true inspirations.
Unity.name: Unity

In Diversity, Unity.description: Increases the loyalty bonus from new building types.
In Diversity, Unity.flavor: The ideal T’au city is an example to all others, displaying a perfect balance of the various castes of the T’au race with their client and auxiliary races, all living in harmony.
In Diversity, Unity.name: In Diversity, Unity

Vectored Retro-Thrusters.description: Increases the movement and ignores enemy zone of control.
Vectored Retro-Thrusters.flavor: The warrior's battlesuit is equipped with supplemental thruster nozzles, allowing him a degree of additional manoeuvrability.
Vectored Retro-Thrusters.name: Vectored Retro-Thrusters

Velocity Tracker.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against flyers.
Velocity Tracker.flavor: These advanced motion-detecting and heat-seeking sensor systems allow pilots to track the movements of airborne targets.
Velocity Tracker.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/Tau/VelocityTracker">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<supportSystemSlots add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Velocity Tracker.name: Velocity Tracker

Volley Fire.description: Increases the ranged attacks if the unit has not moved.
Volley Fire.flavor: Under the constant eye of their Tutor, Fire Caste units learn to take cover, wait for the right moment and fire as one. The resulting volley of pulsed energy hits like neon fireworks and can thoroughly demoralize enemies.
Volley Fire.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/Tau/VolleyFire">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<movement greater="0"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>	
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAttacks mulMin="0.25" mulMax="0.75"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Volley Fire.name: Volley Fire

Zephyr's Grace.flavor:
“Let none doubt that the Tau Empire will bring unity to all – let none doubt that now is our time. Forward, for the Greater Good!”
  — Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit
Zephyr's Grace.name: Zephyr's Grace

Telekine Dome.flavor: Bullets bounce off of thin air and are deflected harmlessly away as the psyker erects a barrier of shimmering energy about himself.
Telekine Dome.name: Telekine Dome

Teleport Homer.description: Causes orbital deployment to not consume action points when deploying Chaplain, Assault Terminators and Terminators adjacent to this unit.
Teleport Homer.flavor: Teleport homers emit a powerful signal enabling orbiting Strike Cruisers to lock onto them with their teleportation equipment. By matching the exact coordinates of this signal, the risk of missing the intended mark is greatly reduced.
Teleport Homer.name: Teleport Homer

Template.description: Hits with increased accuracy against multiple group members of the target unit.
Template.rawXML:
<trait>
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<additionalMembersHit add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon>
					<noTrait name="TwinLinked"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy min="12" max="12"/> 
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="TwinLinked"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy min="14" max="14"/> 
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Template.name: Template

Terminator Armour.flavor: Terminator armour is the best protection a Space Marine can be equipped with. It is even said that Terminator armour can withstand the titanic energies at a plasma generator's core and that this was, in fact, the armour's original purpose.
Terminator Armour.name: Terminator Armour

Tesla.flavor: A tesla weapon unleashes a bolt of living lightning that crackles from foe to foe after hitting its target, charring flesh and melting armour. Tesla bolts feed off the energy released by the destruction, the lightning becoming more furious with every fresh arc.
Tesla.name: Tesla

Viridian Discharge.flavor: The luminous green lightning discharged by these exotic and ancient Necron weapons crackles with life, writhing and seemingly clawing at any target it hits, moving as if it had a mind of its own.
Viridian Discharge.name: Viridian Discharge

The Flesh Is Weak.flavor:
“We have been wounded sorely. Yet still we stand, with fire in our eyes and valour in our hearts. Let them think us beaten. We shall teach them otherwise.”
  — Pedro Kantor, Chapter Master of the Crimson Fists
The Flesh Is Weak.name: The Flesh Is Weak

Trained Sentinel Pilots.flavor: Sentinels are used in a wide variety of roles throughout the Imperium of man—from power lifters used to load starship weaponry to open-canopy scouts. Some Sentinels are equipped with improved armour and stabilisers to carry heavier weaponry. This changes the Sentinel's role from support and reconnaissance to that of a heavy fire platform.
Trained Sentinel Pilots.name: Trained Sentinel Pilots

Traktor.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Weapons/TraktorKannon">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Immobilized" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>
Traktor.name: Traktor

Transport.description: Allows transportation of infantry units and monstrous creatures.
Transport.flavor: Some can carry others across the battlefield, providing speed and protection. Of course, if the transport is destroyed, the passengers will be burnt alive in the explosion.
Transport.name: Transport

Tusked.description: Increases the attacks of melee weapons.
Tusked.name: Tusked

Acid Blood.description: Enemies take damage when they cause melee damage.
Acid Blood.flavor: The alien blood spilt from certain Tyranids is so corrosive that it can eat through ceramite armour and dissolve flesh in mere moments.
Acid Blood.name: Acid Blood

Adaptive Biology.flavor: This hero has been created to adapt against the weaponry used by the current prey world's defenders.
Adaptive Biology.name: Adaptive Biology

Alpha Warrior.flavor:
“To think that Tyranids are mindless beasts is a grave mistake. When you fight Tyranids you face not only those before you on the battlefield, but the untold thousands which seek to surround you, which attack your supporting units and destroy your supply lines in perfect synchronicity.”
  — Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines
Alpha Warrior.name: Alpha Warrior

Biomorph Adaptation.flavor: Far from being born perfectly ready for every situation, Tyranids have variable amounts of adaptability inherent in their DNA. Ramping this capability up is expensive in terms of resources, but allows them to change their behaviour and physical capabilities in the field.
Biomorph Adaptation.name: Biomorph Adaptation

Bounding Leap.description: Negates the movement penalty of rivers.
Bounding Leap.name: Bounding Leap

Brood Progenitor.flavor:
“This horror, this abomination, has thought and purpose that functions on an unimaginable, galactic scale and all we can do is try to stop the swarms of bioengineered monsters it unleashes upon us by instinct.
