We have given the horror a name to salve our fears; we call it the Tyranid race, but if it is aware of us at all it must know us only as Prey.”
  — Inquisitor Czevak
Brood Progenitor.name: Brood Progenitor

Chameleonic Skin.description: Allows overwatch attacks with melee weapons.
Chameleonic Skin.name: Chameleonic Skin

The Spiders' Parlour.flavor: To enter into a mature Tyranid city, is to walk inside giants—hostile, biologically-crafted giants, determined to consume you. Toxin-coated villi lash infantry, valleys sprout teeth and close like maws, and town square-sized sphincters open suddenly, dumping entire unwary armies into acidic reclamation pools.
The Spiders' Parlour.name: The Spiders' Parlour

Aggressive Expansion.flavor: Tyranid cities place little value on size, but focus instead on productivity. As long as a city is efficiently churning out troops, it doesn't matter if it occupies land. But when a city must expand, it can do it extremely rapidly—from sphincters fly hooked tendons, dragging seed pods out to the landscape, where they erupt like Barbed Stranglers. In moments the land is occupied, rapidly gestating a new structure.
Aggressive Expansion.name: Aggressive Expansion

Grey Matter Dispersion.description: Decreases the loyalty penalty from city amount.
Grey Matter Dispersion.flavor: Throughout the hive, from the great producer organisms, to the smaller maintenance creatures, to the substrate itself, small packages of grey matter are dispersed, increasing the ease with which swarm creatures can be controlled.
Grey Matter Dispersion.name: Grey Matter Dispersion

Biogenesis Organelles.flavor: Nothing truly “lives” in a Tyranid city-hive. Mindless 'organelle' creatures spawn and perform crucial functions before being reassimilated. Alterations to the city structure can be made, enabling these organisms to be spawned and reabsorbed in much shorter windows, allowing for their overall population to increase.
Biogenesis Organelles.name: Biogenesis Organelles

Propulsive Parturition.flavor: Waiting for Tyranid newborns to leave their respective mother-buildings is relatively inefficient. Genetors have sighted certain adapted buildings, however, which eject the newborn creature from its birthing sac with an convulsive electric impulse, enabling it to be rapidly re-used.
Propulsive Parturition.name: Propulsive Parturition

Ripper Dispersion.flavor: As the hive matures, the Rippers no longer need to swarm together in such huge numbers for safety. Dispersing them, allows the hive mind to co-ordinate their reclamation behaviour over a wider range.
Ripper Dispersion.name: Ripper Dispersion

Diffusion Field.flavor: In other theatres of war, genetors have noted that the thick cloud of spores emitted by Venomthropes obscure the sight of their enemies. The strain of Maleceptor on Gladius Prime has a similar diffusive effect on enemy attacks, albeit caused by the shadowy tendrils emanating from its encephalic tissue and their direct interference with the consciousness of the opposing troops.
Diffusion Field.name: Diffusion Field

Dominion.description: Increases the Synapse Link radius and the loyalty output of all cities.
Dominion.flavor: The Tyranid uses its prodigious psychic strength to channel and amplify the will of the Hive Mind.
Dominion.name: Dominion

Exploit Weaknesses.flavor:
“We retreat, we fall back, we make strategic withdrawals, we consolidate, we evacuate. When in the name of all that's holy are we going to fight back?”
  — Commissar General Vortigus Hornth, Acting Warmaster; Diatan Sector, Ultima Segmentum
Exploit Weaknesses.name: Exploit Weaknesses

Feeder-Beast.description: Damage caused by this unit is converted into healing.
Feeder-Beast.name: Feeder-Beast

Grasping Tail.flavor: If a Malanthrope must engage in battle, it makes for a difficult foe. Its sinuous body is hard to strike, its grasping tail can immobilise foes or their weapons, and its feeder tendrils are highly poisonous, causing excruciating pain. If a foe becomes paralysed by its tendrils, the Malanthrope will begin to absorb it alive, to acquire the choicest, freshest genetic data.
Grasping Tail.name: Grasping Tail

Hive Commander.description: Increases the damage and damage reduction.
Hive Commander.flavor:
“A new Tyrant joined the fray and, in an eyeblink, the whole character of the swarm changed. The ravening berserker-spirit that had driven the Tyranids onto the ridge was gone as if it had never existed. Left in its place was something cannier and infinitely more worrisome. It was then that I knew the battle to be lost.”
  — Sergeant Torias Telion, Ultramarines 10th Company
Hive Commander.name: Hive Commander

Indescribable Horror.flavor:
“We cannot live through this. Mankind cannot live through this. In a single day they have covered the surface of this planet with a flood of living blades and needle-fanged mouths. Kill one and ten take its place. If they are truly without number then our race is doomed to a violent death before every shred of our civilization is scoured away by a force more voracious than the fires of hell themselves! Death! By the Machine God, Death is here!”
  — Magos Varnak, Overseer of the Tyran research station
Indescribable Horror.name: Indescribable Horror

Gaunt Instincts.flavor: The Hive Mind typically maintains close control over its swarm, directing everything save for unconscious actions—but by loosening that control, the smaller organisms can be allowed just enough agency to forage for themselves.
Gaunt Instincts.name: Gaunt Instincts

Instinctive Behaviour.description: The unit loses morale each turn while not in range of a synapse creature.
Instinctive Behaviour.flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Instinctive Behaviour.rawXML:
<trait alwaysColored="1" category="Debuff" icon="Traits/Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourLurk">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<moraleRegeneration max="0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<morale add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>
Instinctive Behaviour.name: Instinctive Behaviour

Instinctive Behaviour (Feed).description: The unit loses hitpoints each turn while not in range of a synapse creature.
Instinctive Behaviour (Feed).flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Instinctive Behaviour (Feed).name: Instinctive Behaviour (Feed)

Instinctive Behaviour (Hunt).description: The unit loses movement each turn while not in range of a synapse creature.
Instinctive Behaviour (Hunt).flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Instinctive Behaviour (Hunt).name: Instinctive Behaviour (Hunt)

Instinctive Behaviour (Lurk).description: The unit loses morale each turn while not in range of a synapse creature.
Instinctive Behaviour (Lurk).flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Instinctive Behaviour (Lurk).rawXML:
<trait alwaysColored="1" category="Debuff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<moraleRegeneration max="0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<morale mul="-0.1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>
Instinctive Behaviour (Lurk).name: Instinctive Behaviour (Lurk)

Override Instinctive Behaviour.description: The unit's instinctive behaviour is overridden.
Override Instinctive Behaviour.flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Override Instinctive Behaviour.name: Override Instinctive Behaviour

Instinctive Fire.description: Can only target the closest enemy unit.
Instinctive Fire.flavor: The Tyrannocyte is grown by the Hive Fleet as a delivery mechanism, to land its key troops from space and get them closer to the enemy’s biomass. Yet, after its initial purpose has been fulfilled, the near-mindless creature’s work is not done; floating up, it continues to rain organic, acidic hell down and lash its flensing tentacles at anything nearby.
Instinctive Fire.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<enemy/>
						<noTrait name="Invulnerable"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangeMax add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Instinctive Fire.name: Instinctive Fire

Living Battering Ram.flavor: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.
Living Battering Ram.name: Living Battering Ram

Ocular Proliferation.flavor: Targeting enemies at range can be difficult with simple binocular vision. A sensible adaptation is to increase the variety and number of ocular sensors available to the organism, to improve the targeting of all enemy types.
Ocular Proliferation.name: Ocular Proliferation

Mass Incubation.description: Reduces the cooldown of Living Incubator.
Mass Incubation.flavor: Should a Tervigon need it, it can birth its entire brood rapidly. An opponent focused on this single opponent may find itself suddenly outnumbered.
Mass Incubation.name: Mass Incubation

Bioweapon Symbiosis.flavor: When the Tyranids were first encountered, particularly their forerunners the Zoats, their weaponry was typically a range of separate organisms. As time has gone by, the Tyranids and their weapons have grown closer together.
Bioweapon Symbiosis.name: Bioweapon Symbiosis

Onslaught.flavor: The synapse creature reaches out its mind and seizes control of the lesser creatures' weapon symbiotes, guiding their fire whilst simultaneously driving the swarms towards the enemy at a breakneck pace.
Onslaught.name: Onslaught

Paroxysm.flavor: The Hive Mind debilitates its enemies by triggering every nerve and pain receptor in their bodies, overwhelming their senses with wracking fits of agony.
Paroxysm.name: Paroxysm

Prey Adaptation.description: The Hive mind gains research when the Malanthrope gains experience from combat.
Prey Adaptation.flavor: The Malanthrope doesn't just garner new genetic data from fallen corpses—it is also quite capable of observing the learned patterns communicated by creatures to one another, whether parent or teacher, and retaining that for encoding into the Hive Mind's creatures.
Prey Adaptation.name: Prey Adaptation

Birthing Canals.flavor: A simple shift in the structure of the great organisms that make up the Tyranid hive, birthing canals are something like biological production lines, enabling many creatures to be produced in parallel without the direct oversight of the Hive Mind.
Birthing Canals.name: Birthing Canals

Psychic Barrier.flavor: Tyranid horrors the size of the Maleceptor are not without inherent defenses. But beyond its sheer bulk and resilient armour, the Malceptor also projects a formidable psychic barrier, capable of vaporizing or deflecting bullets and energy bolts fired at it before they strike it.
Psychic Barrier.name: Psychic Barrier

Psychic Overload.flavor: The ethereal pseudopods projected by a Maleceptor’s encephalic tissue are manifestations of the Shadow in the Warp itself, the Hive Mind’s nullifying psychic presence. If these should even brush a weakened opponent’s consciousness, they will directly experience the horrifying immensity of that immanence—and die rapidly, horribly and explosively.
Psychic Overload.name: Psychic Overload

Raking Strike.description: Increases the Hive Crone's melee attacks. Additionally increases the melee attacks against flyers.
Raking Strike.flavor: Lengthening and hardening the bladed spurs on a Hive Crone's underside allows it to perform lethal fly-by strikes against enemies. In addition, sharpened wingtips enable the Crone to accurately target enemy pilots.
Raking Strike.name: Raking Strike

Rapacious Hunger.flavor: To see a Haruspex in a full feeding frenzy is to recognise your life is already lost—not in the creature's jetbike-sized maw necessarily, but to what the Haruspex symbolises. These creatures are normally only deployed at the end of a planetary invasion—so to see them is to accept that your planet is almost certainly doomed.
Rapacious Hunger.name: Rapacious Hunger

Scavenger Adaptation.flavor: The Hive Mind typically maintains close control over its swarm, directing everything but unconscious actions—but by loosening that control, the smaller organisms can be allowed just enough agency to forage for themselves.
Scavenger Adaptation.name: Scavenger Adaptation

Scourge of the Brood.flavor:
“As I looked into its dead black eyes, I saw the terrible sentience it had in place of a soul. Behind that was the steel will of its leader. Further still I could feel its primogenitor coldly assessing me from the void. And looking back from the deepest recesses of the alien's mind I perceived what I can only describe as an immortal hunger.”
  — Chief Librarian Varro Tigurius of the Ultramarines
Scourge of the Brood.name: Scourge of the Brood

Shadow In The Warp.flavor: The unfathomable presence of the Hive Mind radiates out from its synapse creatures, smothering the ability of the psykers who stand before them to draw upon their mystic powers.
Shadow In The Warp.name: Shadow In The Warp

Gigaborer Hives.flavor: The unique and disgusting Borer nest is comprised of a compact nest of Borer beetles, acidic insectoids that launch themselves in a frenzy from the weapon. Gigaborer Hives contain fewer, much larger beetles, simply enabling more damage.
Gigaborer Hives.name: Gigaborer Hives

Singular Purpose.description: Norn Emissaries have increased accuracy and damage against this unit.
Singular Purpose.flavor: Spawned by Norn queens, this Emissary’s role on a battlefield is the removal of an opposing force’s lynchpin—the leaders or the key troops whose loss will precipitate the collapse of the opposition forces. Gifted with unique knowledge of its target, an Emissary rarely fails in its purpose.
Singular Purpose.name: Singular Purpose

Spore Cloud.flavor: The best possible tactic against Tyranids is decapitation—namely, the execution of the synapse creatures that relay the Norn Queen's commands. Unfortunately, through the fluid mass of sinuous flesh that constitutes a Tyranid assault, the hail of acidic and living projectiles, and the obfuscating spore clouds, even a Vindicare assassin would have trouble picking out a Dominatrix, let alone a Tyrant.
Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud

Symbiotic Targeting.description: Increases the ranged accuracy if the unit remains stationary.
Symbiotic Targeting.name: Symbiotic Targeting

Synapse Link.description: The unit cannot be shaken or broken, is immune to fear and is not subject to instinctive behaviour.
Synapse Link.flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Synapse Link.name: Synapse Link

Synaptic Backlash.description: Termagants in the area take damage when the Tervigon dies.
Synaptic Backlash.flavor: Though Tyranids have no affection one another—they will watch calmly as their nest-mates die or walk into the reclamation pool—the psychic trauma a Tervigon's brood suffers at the moment of its death is odd, particularly given the Hive Mind's seeming inability to eliminate it. Perhaps it is a legacy of whatever long-dead race the Tervigon's genetic data was based on—and a symbol that the Hive Mind rarely innovates, but mostly plagiarises.
Synaptic Backlash.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Debuff">
	<onUnitDisappeared>
		<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<type name="Tyranids/Termagant"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
		
	</onUnitDisappeared>
	
</trait>
Synaptic Backlash.name: Synaptic Backlash

Toxin Sacs.description: Increases the damage of melee weapons against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Toxin Sacs.flavor: These parasitic glands secrete vile fluids, coating the Tyranid's claws, fangs and talons with a lethal variety of alien poisons.
Toxin Sacs.rawXML:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="Melee"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage add="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Toxin Sacs.name: Toxin Sacs

Echiurean Walls.flavor: Broodhive walls are grown rapidly, meaning they tend to be relatively flimsy creatures, for the Tyranids. Genetors have observed adaptations that grow more slowly, but accrete muscle mass over time, and generally are more resilient to enemy action.
Echiurean Walls.name: Echiurean Walls

Unnatural Resilience.description: Increases invulnerable damage reduction and grants additional feel no pain damage reduction.
Unnatural Resilience.flavor: Imbued with purpose by the Norn Queen, the Emissary adapts instantly to injuries that would cripple another creature, shrugging off death to pursue its goal.
Unnatural Resilience.name: Unnatural Resilience

Megaunt Instincts.flavor: The Hive Mind typically maintains close control over its swarm, directing everything but unconscious actions, save for its alpha creatures—but by loosening that control, larger organisms can direct or predate on the smaller organisms, enabling them to survive without direct control.
Megaunt Instincts.name: Megaunt Instincts

Warp Field.flavor: Zoanthropes are vital nodes for harnessing the Hive Mind's psychic might and are created with a powerful sense of self-preservation. Therefore, they instinctively project a potent Warp field to protect themselves in battle – a mental shield that is invisible but for a slight shimmer when small-arms and heavy-weapons fire alike patters harmlessly against it.
Warp Field.name: Warp Field

Twin-Linked.flavor: These weapons are grafted to the same targeting system for greater accuracy.
Twin-Linked.name: Twin-Linked

Unending Horde.flavor: Like the zombies of ancient Terran fiction, Poxwalkers do not stop unless they are thoroughly destroyed. Their dead flesh is unfeeling, so that attacks that would put down a normal human are mere inconveniences as they giggle and groan onward…
Unending Horde.name: Unending Horde

Unique.description: Limits the amount of units of this type.
Unique.name: Unique

Unwieldy.flavor: This weapon is very large, and more than a little clumsy, making swift blows all but impossible to achieve.
Unwieldy.name: Unwieldy

Vectored Afterburners.description: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.
Vectored Afterburners.name: Vectored Afterburners

Vehicle.description: Negates the penalty for heavy and ordnance weapons. Increases the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Vehicle.flavor: War is not a trade solely for living soldiers, but also for mighty war engines and tanks.
Vehicle.name: Vehicle

Very Bulky.description: Requires two additional cargo slots in a transport.
Very Bulky.flavor: This creature is so massive it takes up an inordinate amount of space in any vehicle or building it enters.
Very Bulky.name: Very Bulky

Void Shield.flavor: The Void Shield is the peak Imperial ranged-defense technology and is normally only mounted on Titans and Superheavy Tanks because of its immense power needs. This variant uses the technology to defend a wide area, though it is useless against melee attacks.
Void Shield.name: Void Shield

Vox-Caster.flavor: A vox-caster is a reliable communications array connected to the tactical command net via tight-beam transmitters.
Vox-Caster.name: Vox-Caster

Waaagh!.flavor: The Waaagh! is joie de vivre, crusade, immense psychic power, a tangible belief aura and perhaps the Ork gods themselves, all rolled into one teeth-rattling, gut-wrenching roar of delighted aggression pushing the Orks across the galaxy and into battle. It is the core of being an Ork.
Waaagh!.rawXML:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="9">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<attacks mulMin="0.02" mulMax="0.20"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<effects>
				<loyalty mulMin="0.02" mulMax="0.20"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>
Waaagh!.name: Waaagh!

Walker.description: Reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Walker.name: Walker

Wire Weed.flavor: Woe betide anyone who wanders into these thickets of brambles. Slowly at first, but faster and faster, the living weed draws its razor-sharp filaments tighter around the hapless intruder.
Wire Weed.rawXML:
<trait category="Debuff" icon="Features/WireWeed">
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Necrons/ImmuneToNaturalLaw"/>
					<noTrait name="Necrons/Wraithflight"/>
					<noTrait name="JetPack"/>
					<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
					<noTrait name="Skimmer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<weaponDamage weapon="WireWeed"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>
Wire Weed.name: Wire Weed

Zzap.flavor: Zzap guns fire unstable bolts of lightning. They have the potential to punch through the hull of even the heaviest enemy vehicle amid crackling showers of sparks, but have a tendency to overload and electrocute the operating gunner.
Zzap.name: Zzap

Zealot.description: Reduces the morale loss, increases the melee damage and grants immunity to fear and pinning.
Zealot.flavor: Zealots fight on regardless of their casualties or the terrors of war; they are driven forwards by their conviction.
Zealot.name: Zealot
